intro: Sphaeralcea coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped and opposite. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Sphaeralcea coulteri is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
